name: v6.1.0
body:
### Feature
* Support PYPI_TOKEN on GitHub Actions (df2c0806f0a92186e914cfc8cc992171d74422df)
* Support easier use of API tokens (bac135c0ae7a6053ecfc7cdf2942c3c89640debf)

### Documentation
* Add documentation for PYPI_TOKEN (a8263a066177d1d42f2844e4cb42a76a23588500)

---

*Extra note from @AlphaMycelium:*

This release adds proper support for PyPI authentication using API tokens. Although this is not a breaking change, I strongly recommend you switch to it for the following reasons:

- It is [recommended by PyPI](https://pypi.org/help/#apitoken).
- Tokens can be given access to a single project, which reduces the possible damage if it is compromised.
- If your PyPI username is the same as your GitHub and you have it set as a secret in a CI service, they will likely scrub it from the build output. This can break things, for example repository links.

body:
### Feature

### Fix

### Fix

### Feature

### Fix
* Rename default of build_command config (d5db22f9f7acd05d20fd60a8b4b5a35d4bbfabb8)

### Documentation
* Update docstings in pypi.py (6502d448fa65e5dc100e32595e83fff6f62a881a)

### Breaking change
Previously the build_commands configuration variable set the types of bundles sent to `python setup.py`. It has been replaced by the configuration variable `build_command` which takes the full command e.g. `python setup.py sdist` or `poetry build`.

### Feature
- Add option for choosing between version source by committed file or tag by setting `version_source` to commit or tag.

### Feature

- Make tag parser work correctly with breaking changes
- Improve cli --help and error messages
- Use click subcommands in cli

### Documentation
- Add info about trello board in readme
- Update info about releases in contributing.md
- Add info about correct commit guidelines

:v:

### Documentation
- Fix typo in setup.cfg section

### Feature
- Add checks for semaphore

### Documentation
- Add step by step guide for configuring travis ci
- Remove duplicate readme
- Add note about node semantic release
- Move automatic-releases to subfolder
- Add documentation for configuring on CI

### Feature
- Checkout master before publishing
- Add author in commit

### Fix
- Remove " from git push command

### Documentation
- Convert readme to rst

### Feature
- Add travis environment checks

### Fix
- Change build badge

### Documentation
- Update docstrings for generate_changelog

name: v3.3.1
body: - fix: Only list commits from the last version tag

### Feature
- Add support for environment variables for pypi credentials

### Fix
- Downgrade twine to version 1.5.0
- Add missing parameters to twine.upload
- Push to master by default
- Better filtering of github token in push error
- Make sure the github token is not in the output

### Feature
- Add option to disable pypi upload

### Feature
- Add tag parser

### Fix
- Add exposing of errors in package
- Parse file instead for running python setup.py --version

### Breaking
- Rename `UnknownCommitMessageStyle` to `UnknownCommitMessageStyleError`

### Fix
- Fix property calls

### Fix
- Make Github.token an property

### Documentation
- Update readme with information about the changelog command
- Add documentation about commit parsers
- Update apidocs

### Fix
- Fix call to generate_changelog in publish

### Fix
- Fix issue in get_previous_version

### Feature
- Add the possibility to repost the changelog

### Fix
- Fix check of token in changelog command
- Fix the github releases integration
- Fix changelog generation

### Feature
- Add publishing of changelog to github
- Add github release changelog helper
- Add markdown changelog formatter
- Add command for printing the changelog
- Add generate_changelog function
- Set angular parser as the default
- Add loading of current parser
- Add angular parser

### Fix
- Change output indentation on changelog
- Support unexpected types in changelog generator
- Fix regex in angular parser
- Fix level id's in angular parser

### Breaking
- This changes the default parser. Thus, the default behaviour of the commit log evaluator will change. From now on it will use the angular commit message spec to determine the new version.

This makes all future breaking changes trigger a new major release.

#### Breaking changes
- Move functions from helpers.py into history.py and pypi.py. [See api docs for more information](http://python-semantic-release.readthedocs.org/en/latest/api/semantic_release.html)
Fix `get_current_head_hash`, ensure it only returns the hash and not the branch name as well.
Adds python2 support, thanks to @jezdez for the contribution.
Add option `check_build_status` which if set to true will check build status on github and abort the creation of new version if the state is something else than `success`. This is off by default.
Adds `patch_without_tag` option, which if set to true will make semantic-release create a new patch release even if there is no tag in any commits since last release. This is off by default.
- Add uploading to pypi with twine

- Add support for tagging
- Fix isse when version should not change
- If there are only untagged(as in major, minor, patch) commits since last release there will be no release

- `--noop mode`.
- Swapped pygit2 with gitpython to avoid libgit2 dependecy.
- Fix entry point

Basic functionality for detecting current version, detecting next version and changing version before committing version.

:sparkles:
